      "9141d2c9-159f-4516-b7de-c3bd9127961d": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",

          "created_time": 1550715465283,
          "id": "9141d2c9-159f-4516-b7de-c3bd9127961d",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1550715465283,
          "parent_id": "e603fbe6-2240-4d1e-a3c9-174a498ceed0",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["Immediately-invoked function expressions", [["i"]]],
              [" (or, perhaps more intuitively, "],
              ["self-executing anonymous functions", [["i"]]],
              [
                ") are essentially closures that are called right after declaration. The general idea with IIFE’s is to invoke the side-effect of creating a separate context that is accessible only to the code within the IIFE."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
      "9c0e1c5e-88eb-4838-b0dd-8375a23f653c": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1550715465282,
          "id": "9c0e1c5e-88eb-4838-b0dd-8375a23f653c",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",

          "parent_id": "e603fbe6-2240-4d1e-a3c9-174a498ceed0",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["In the above example, when "],
              ["foo", [["c"]]],
              [" is called, its context is captured in the function "],
              ["bar", [["c"]]],
              [". So even after it returns, "],
              ["bar", [["c"]]],
              [" can still access and modify the variable "],
              ["x", [["c"]]],
              [". The function "],
              ["foo", [["c"]]],
              [
                ", whose context is captured in another function, is said to be a "
              ],
              ["closure", [["i"]]],
              ["."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["When "],
              ["makeCounter()", [["c"]]],
              [
                " is called, a snapshot of the context of that function is saved. All code inside "
              ],
              ["makeCounter()", [["c"]]],
              [" will use that snapshot in their execution. Two calls of "],
              ["makeCounter()", [["c"]]],
              [
                " will thus create two different snapshots, with their own copy of "
              ],
              ["counter", [["c"]]],
              ["."]
            ]
          },

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["When a function is declared, variables in the context of its "],
              ["declaration", [["i"]]],
              [
                " are captured in its scope. For example, in the code below, the variable "
              ],
              ["x", [["c"]]],
              [
                " is bound to a value in the outer scope, and then the reference to "
              ],
              ["x", [["c"]]],
              [" is captured in the context of "],
              ["bar", [["c"]]],
              [":"]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
      "e603fbe6-2240-4d1e-a3c9-174a498ceed0": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "content": [
            "e142e569-b5d5-45e6-97e8-b64a182bce63",
            "4a4361db-4af8-4400-aa8d-2fa43a7f5fdb",
            "58620350-fa40-416a-973c-b01110e75ce2",
            "75f3a064-a7b1-453f-8ca0-39ec9c0dfae6",
            "26ec87b5-5de2-4877-90e5-ed1fd1f7bf8b",
